distributed.hadoop

Class HDFSUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • distributed.hadoop.HDFSUtils

  • public class HDFSUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Bunch of utility routines for HDFS. Includes stuff for moving/copying files in and out of HDFS, installing Weka libraries in HDFS, adding stuff to the distributed cache for a job and populating the classpath for map/reduce tasks.
    Version:
    $Revision: 11837 $
    Author:
    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String WEKA_LIBRARIES_LOCATION
      The default location in HDFS to place weka.jar and other libraries for inclusion in the classpath of the hadoop nodes
      static java.lang.String WEKA_TEMP_DISTRIBUTED_CACHE_FILES
      Staging location for non library files to be distributed to the nodes by the distributed cache
      static java.lang.String WINDOWS_ACCESSING_HADOOP_ON_LINUX_SYS_PROP
      Users need to set HADOOP_ON_LINUX environment variable to "true" if accessing a *nix Hadoop cluster from Windows so that we can post-process the job classpath in the Configuration file to use ':' rather than ';' as separators.

      static void checkForWindowsAccessingHadoopOnLinux(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)

      • WEKA_LIBRARIES_LOCATION

        public static final java.lang.String WEKA_LIBRARIES_LOCATION
        The default location in HDFS to place weka.jar and other libraries for inclusion in the classpath of the hadoop nodes
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WINDOWS_ACCESSING_HADOOP_ON_LINUX_SYS_PROP

        public static final java.lang.String WINDOWS_ACCESSING_HADOOP_ON_LINUX_SYS_PROP
        Users need to set HADOOP_ON_LINUX environment variable to "true" if accessing a *nix Hadoop cluster from Windows so that we can post-process the job classpath in the Configuration file to use ':' rather than ';' as separators.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WEKA_TEMP_DISTRIBUTED_CACHE_FILES

        public static final java.lang.String WEKA_TEMP_DISTRIBUTED_CACHE_FILES
        Staging location for non library files to be distributed to the nodes by the distributed cache
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

                           Environment env)
        Utility method to resolve all environment variables in a given path
        Parameters:
        path - the path in HDFS
        env - environment variables to use
        Returns:
        the path with all environment variables resolved

                       throws java.io.IOException
        Copy a local file into HDFS
        Parameters:
        localFile - the path to the local file
        hdfsPath - the destination path in HDFS
        config - the HDFSConfig containing connection details
        env - environment variables
        overwrite - true if the destination should be overwritten (if it already exists)

        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs

      • checkForWindowsAccessingHadoopOnLinux

        public static void checkForWindowsAccessingHadoopOnLinux(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
        If accessing Hadoop running on a *nix system from Windows then we have to post-process the classpath setup for the job because it will contain ';' rather than ':' as the separator.
        Parameters:
        conf - the Configuration to fix up.

      • addFileToClasspath

        public static void addFileToClasspath(HDFSConfig hdfsConfig,
                      org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                      java.lang.String path,
                      Environment env)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a file in HDFS to the classpath for hadoop nodes (via the DistributedCache)
        Parameters:
        hdfsConfig - the HDFSConfig object with host and port set
        conf - the Configuration object that will be changed by this operation
        path - the path to the file (in HDFS) to be added to the classpath for hadopp nodes
        env - any environment variables
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs

        paths - a list of paths (in HDFS) to be added to the classpath for hadopp nodes
        env - any environment variables
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs

        paths - a list of paths (relative to the Weka installation root in HDFS) to add to the classpath for mappers and reducers

      • serializeObjectToDistributedCache

        public static void serializeObjectToDistributedCache(java.lang.Object toSerialize,
                                     HDFSConfig hdfsConfig,
                                     org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                     java.lang.String fileNameInCache,
                                     Environment env)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Serializes the given object into a file in the staging area in HDFS and then adds that file to the distributed cache for the configuration
        Parameters:
        toSerialize - the object to serialize
        hdfsConfig - the hdfs configuration to use
        conf - the job configuration to configure
        fileNameInCache - the file name only for the serialized object in the cache
        env - environment variables
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs

      • addFileToDistributedCache

        public static java.lang.String addFileToDistributedCache(HDFSConfig hdfsConfig,
                                         org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                         java.lang.String path,
                                         Environment env)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a file to the distributed cache for the supplied Configuration
        Parameters:
        hdfsConfig - the hdfs configuration to use
        conf - the job configuration to configure
        path - the path to the file to add. This can be a local file, in which case it is first staged in HDFS, or a file in HDFS.
        env - environment variables
        Returns:
        the filename only part of the path (this is what will be accessible from the distributed cache to a client via standard Java file IO)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs

      • addFilesToDistributedCache

        public static void addFilesToDistributedCache(HDFSConfig hdfsConfig,
                              org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> paths,
                              Environment env)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a set of files to the distributed cache for the supplied Configuration
        Parameters:
        hdfsConfig - the hdfs configuration to use
        conf - the job configuration to configure
        paths - a list of paths to to add to the distributed cache. These can be a local files, in which case they are first staged in HDFS, or a files in HDFS, or a mixture of both.
        env - environment variables from the distributed cache to a client via standard Java file IO)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs
        java.lang.Exception
